title: Font used by Saul Bass, in "The man with the golden arm" poster
content:
Hello everyone!

I can't remember the name of the font used by Saul Bass, in "The man with the golden arm" poster!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109174910im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Saul_bass_goldenarm_6225.jpg)

I used to know it...and I know that its glyphs changes according with the glyph that precedes and follows!

Thank you all for the attention!  
Bye :)
author: VisualPollution

comments.content:
Saul Bass used to do this all by hand. But there are two fonts which you may like

[Ed Interlock](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109174910/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=150) by House Industries  
and [Sinzano](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109174910/http:/www.identifont.com/show?GGB) by Ray Larabie.

EDIT: Oh, yes, fontdiner is a great option, too.

Try our Square Meal and Square Meal Hearty fonts in the [County Fair Picnic Font Set](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109174910/http:/www.fontdiner.com/menu_cfp.html) - They were inspired by the lettering from that poster . . .

Stuart :D
You might wanna take a look at [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20141109174910/http:/typographica.org/001110.php).

Unfortunately one can’t contribute to the moratorium anymore.
